criteria.name: Major
criteria.description: Agent A makes a claim “c” intended to influence Agent B

criteria.name: Minor I
criteria.description: Claim “c” consists of information regarding some value “v”, action “alpha”, or state “s”.

criteria.name: Minor II
criteria.description: Agent A stands to benefit from Agent B accepting “c”

criteria.name: Conclusion
criteria.description: Agent A's claim “c” should be scrutinised for deception

criteria.name: CQ1
criteria.description: What values of B are promoted (respectively demoted) by “c”?

criteria.name: CQ2
criteria.description: How do B's actions or beliefs change based on accepting “c”?

criteria.name: CQ3
criteria.description: Does A have a history of being a reliable source of information?

criteria.name: CQ4
criteria.description: What potential benefit does A have from B accepting “c”

criteria.name: CQ5
criteria.description: What potential future loss does “A” risk from “B” accepting “c”?

criteria.name: CQ6
criteria.description: Are there any inconsistencies or discrepancies in “c”, “v”, “alpha”, or “s”?

criteria.name: CQ7
criteria.description: Are there independent verifications or counterclaims to “c” with respect to “v”, “alpha”, or “s”?

criteria.name: CQ8
criteria.description: Is “c”, with respect to “v”, “alpha”, or “s”, consistent with A's knowledge, experience, and personality?
